block.p: Sona Sophia Chong, the daughter of Sung Ja Chong and Kwang Hae Chong of Wheaton, Md., was married on Friday to Harry Jho, a son of Judy and Duke Jho of Forest Hills, Queens. The Rev. Dr. Haeng Duk Chung, an Evangelical Baptist minister and a great-uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at Estherwood, a historic house in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y.

Mrs. Jho, 31, produces educational programs in Manhattan and Nashville for WNPT-TV, a public station in Nashville. She graduated from Bryn Mawr and received a master's degree in education from Harvard. Her father owns and manages Better Siding, an installation business in Wheaton.

Sona Sophia Chong, the daughter of Sung Ja Chong and Kwang Hae Chong of Wheaton, Md., was married on Friday to Harry Jho, a son of Judy and Duke Jho of Forest Hills, Queens. The Rev. Dr. Haeng Duk Chung, an Evangelical Baptist minister and a great-uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at Estherwood, a historic house in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y.

Mrs. Jho, 31, produces educational programs in Manhattan and Nashville for WNPT-TV, a public station in Nashville. She graduated from Bryn Mawr and received a master's degree in education from Harvard. Her father owns and manages Better Siding, an installation business in Wheaton.

Mr. Jho, 27, is an associate at Davis Polk & Wardwell, the Manhattan law firm. He graduated with highest distinction from the University of Michigan and received a law degree from Yale. His parents own and operate Rego-Forest Cleaners in Forest Hills.
